summary: The Congressional Award Foundation is a privately-funded charity established by Congress that recognizes American youth for their public service, personal development, physical fitness, and exploration of other cultures or the wilderness. Law requires the Foundation to have its financial statements audited each year, and we're required to review those audits. The Foundation's auditor issued an "unmodified" (clean) opinion of its FY2020 financial statements, concluding that...
title: Congressional Award Foundation: Review of the FY 2020 Financial Statement Audit
